unnormalised: Electoral reforms are crucial for deepening Indian democracy. Addressing issues like criminalization of politics and campaign finance transparency is paramount. Implementation of the Dinesh Goswami Committee recommendations remains vital. Strengthening the Election Commission of India (ECI) and promoting voter awareness, especially in states like Bihar, are necessary. Digital voting systems should be explored cautiously, ensuring data security and accessibility for all, even in areas with limited internet penetration. Disqualifying candidates with pending criminal charges above a certain threshold (e.g., those related to serious offenses) is a must. The influence of black money (Rs.) needs serious regulation. Effective reform ensures fairer elections and a more representative governance across 1.3 billion people.
